org.jamwiki

Class WikiMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamwiki.WikiMessage

  • public class WikiMessage
extends Object
    This class is a utility class useful for storing messages key and object values that can later be displayed using the jstl fmt:message tag.
    See Also:
    WikiMessageParam

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WikiMessage(String key)
      Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value.
      WikiMessage(String key, List<String> paramList)
      Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using an list of parameters.
      WikiMessage(String key, String param1)
      Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using a single parameter.
      WikiMessage(String key, String[] params)
      Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using an array of parameters.
      WikiMessage(String key, String param1, String param2)
      Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using two parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addParam(String param)
      Add a string param to this WikiMessage object.
      void addWikiLinkParam(String wikiLinkParam)
      Add a wiki link param to this WikiMessage object.
      void addWikiLinkParam(String wikiLinkParam, String wikiLinkParamText)
      Add a wiki link param to this WikiMessage object.
      String getKey()
      Return the ApplicationResources message key associated with this message.
      WikiMessageParam[] getParams()
      Return the array of parameter objects associated with this message.
      int getParamsLength()
      Return the number of params assigned to this WikiMessage.
      void replaceParameter(int index, String parameter)
      Utility method for replacing a specified WikiMessage paramter.
      void setParamsWithoutEscaping(String[] params)
      This set method allows message parameters to be set without being escaped.
      String toString()
      Override the toString method to return the key and params used by this message object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WikiMessage

        public WikiMessage(String key)
        Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value.
        Parameters:
        key - The ApplicationResources key that corresponds to the message to display.

      • WikiMessage

        public WikiMessage(String key,
                   String param1)
        Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using a single parameter.
        Parameters:
        key - The ApplicationResources key that corresponds to the message to display.
        param1 - The parameter that corresponds to the {0} param in the specified message key value. Note that this parameter is automatically HTML escaped to prevent erorrs in display.

      • WikiMessage

        public WikiMessage(String key,
                   String param1,
                   String param2)
        Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using two parameters.
        Parameters:
        key - The ApplicationResources key that corresponds to the message to display.
        param1 - The parameter that corresponds to the {0} param in the specified message key value. Note that this parameter is automatically HTML escaped to prevent erorrs in display.
        param2 - The parameter that corresponds to the {1} param in the specified message key value. Note that this parameter is automatically HTML escaped to prevent erorrs in display.

      • WikiMessage

        public WikiMessage(String key,
                   String[] params)
        Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using an array of parameters.
        Parameters:
        key - The ApplicationResources key that corresponds to the message to display.
        params - An array of parameters that correspond to the {0}, {1}, etc params in the specified message key value. Note that these parameters are automatically HTML escaped to prevent erorrs in display.

      • WikiMessage

        public WikiMessage(String key,
                   List<String> paramList)
        Create a new message that is mapped to the specified ApplicationResources key value using an list of parameters.
        Parameters:
        key - The ApplicationResources key that corresponds to the message to display.
        paramList - An list of parameters that correspond to the {0}, {1}, etc params in the specified message key value. Note that these parameters are automatically HTML escaped to prevent erorrs in display.

    • Method Detail

      • addParam

        public void addParam(String param)
        Add a string param to this WikiMessage object. The param will be HTML-escaped to prevent formatting issues or XSS issues.
        Parameters:
        param - A string that will be processed with the fmt:param tag when this wiki message is rendered.

      • addWikiLinkParam

        public void addWikiLinkParam(String wikiLinkParam)
        Add a wiki link param to this WikiMessage object.
        Parameters:
        wikiLinkParam - A string that will be processed with the jamwiki:link tag when this wiki message is rendered.

      • addWikiLinkParam

        public void addWikiLinkParam(String wikiLinkParam,
                             String wikiLinkParamText)
        Add a wiki link param to this WikiMessage object.
        Parameters:
        wikiLinkParam - A string that will be processed with the jamwiki:link tag when this wiki message is rendered.
        wikiLinkParamText - A string that will be used as text with the jamwiki:link tag when this wiki message is rendered.

      • getKey

        public String getKey()
        Return the ApplicationResources message key associated with this message.
        Returns:
        The ApplicationResources message key associated with this message.

      • getParams

        public WikiMessageParam[] getParams()
        Return the array of parameter objects associated with this message.
        Returns:
        The array of parameter objects associated with this message.

      • getParamsLength

        public int getParamsLength()
        Return the number of params assigned to this WikiMessage.
        Returns:
        The number of params assigned to this WikiMessage.

      • setParamsWithoutEscaping

        public void setParamsWithoutEscaping(String[] params)
        This set method allows message parameters to be set without being escaped. Note that this can be a gaping security hole as it opens the site up to cross-site scripting attacks. USE THIS METHOD ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
        Parameters:
        params - The array of parameter objects to associate with this message.

      • replaceParameter

        public void replaceParameter(int index,
                             String parameter)
        Utility method for replacing a specified WikiMessage paramter. If no parameter exists at the specified index then an error will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - The message parameter to replace, starting with zero.
        parameter - The value to replace the current parameter with.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the existing message parameter array is shorter than the specified index.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Override the toString method to return the key and params used by this message object. This capability is useful mainly for logging purposes when formatting by locale is not required.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this WikiMessage including the message key and any params.
